Package org.knime.core.ui.node.workflow.async

Interface AsyncWorkflowManagerUI

All Superinterfaces:
AsyncNodeContainerUI, AsyncUI, EventListener, org.knime.core.node.workflow.NodeContainerStateObservable, NodeContainerUI, org.knime.core.node.workflow.NodeProgressListener, UI, WorkflowManagerUI
public interface AsyncWorkflowManagerUI extends WorkflowManagerUI, AsyncNodeContainerUI
UI-interface that provides asynchronous versions of some methods of WorkflowManagerUI - see AsyncUI. The asynchronous workflow manager also adds methods to refresh the workflow, set a workflow disconnected, etc.
Author:
Martin Horn, KNIME GmbH, Konstanz, Germany

    • createAndAddNode

      default org.knime.core.node.workflow.NodeID createAndAddNode(org.knime.core.node.NodeFactory<?> factory, org.knime.core.node.workflow.NodeUIInformation uiInfo)
      Uses given factory to create a new node and then adds new node to the workflow manager. We will automatically find the next available free index for the new node within the given prefix.
      Specified by:
      createAndAddNode in interface WorkflowManagerUI
      Parameters:
      factory - the factory representing the new node
      uiInfo - essentially the position of the new node
      Returns:
      newly created (unique) NodeID

    • replaceNode

      default UndoableUI replaceNode(org.knime.core.node.workflow.NodeID id, org.knime.core.node.context.ModifiableNodeCreationConfiguration creationConfig)
      Replaces a node with same type of node but another NodeCreationConfiguration, e.g. in order to change the ports. Operation is only applicable for NativeNodeContainers. Otherwise an IllegalAccessException will be thrown. Node settings and annotation will be transfered to the new node. Incoming and outgoing connections will be kept as far as possible (if the respective input and output port is still there and compatible).
      Specified by:
      replaceNode in interface WorkflowManagerUI
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the node to replace
      creationConfig - node creation configuration to create the new node
      Returns:
      undo object

    • replaceNodeAsync

      Async version of replaceNode(NodeID, ModifiableNodeCreationConfiguration).
      Parameters:
      id -
      creationConfig -
      Returns:
      void as future - throws a OperationNotAllowedException if operation couldn't be performed (e.g. because there are executing node's successors) on CompletableFutureEx.getOrThrow()

      Removes the given workflow parts. If there is no corresponding part for a given id, it will be ignored.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      nodeIDs - the ids of the nodes to be removed or null.
      connectionIDs - the ids of the connections to be removed or null.
      annotationIDs - the ids of the workflow annotations to be removed or null.

    • refreshAsync

      CompletableFuture<Void> refreshAsync(boolean deepRefresh)
      Refreshes the workflow (e.g. downloads the new state) asynchronously. If a job is swapped it will be copied back to memory.
      Parameters:
      deepRefresh - if true the workflow itself and all contained sub-workflows (i.e. metanodes) will be refreshed, if false only the top level workflow will be refreshed.
      Returns:
      a future for async use

    • refreshOrFail

      void refreshOrFail(boolean deepRefresh) throws SnapshotNotFoundException
      Refreshes the workflow (e.g. downloads the new state) and returns when done or fails with an SnapshotNotFoundException.
      Parameters:
      deepRefresh - if true the workflow itself and all contained sub-workflows (i.e. metanodes) will be refreshed, if false only the top level workflow will be refreshed
      Throws:
      SnapshotNotFoundException - if refresh is not possible because the locally hold snapshot is not known to the server (anymore), see SnapshotNotFoundException for possible reasons

    • setConnectionProblem

      void setConnectionProblem(String message)
      Sets a connection problem message and therewith also the overall the connection-state of the workflow manager. I.e. in case the workflow manager implementation is just a client and has, e.g., lost the connection to the server. The 'connected'-state is represented by a problem-message _not_ being present. The state is sync'd between all related workflow managers (i.e. parent or children).
      Parameters:
      message - a message if the workflow is not connected anymore or null if it's connected

    • getConnectionProblem

      Optional<String> getConnectionProblem()
      Returns:
      a connection problem message if disconnected or an empty optional if connected

    • addWriteProtectionChangedListener

      void addWriteProtectionChangedListener(Runnable listener)
      Parameters:
      listener - listener that gets informed when the write protection status has changed. The actual status can be accessed via WorkflowManagerUI.isWriteProtected().

    • removeWriteProtectionChangedListener

      void removeWriteProtectionChangedListener(Runnable listener)
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to be removed and to not be called anymore

    • setReadOnly

      void setReadOnly(boolean readOnly)
      Sets the UI to read only.
      Parameters:
      readOnly - true if it is read only, false otherwise
